org.jpws.pwslib.crypto

Interface PwsCipher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlowfishCipher, CipherModeCBC, NullCipher, TwofishCipher

    public interface PwsCipher
    Interface for a cryptographic algorithm along the Block Cipher blend. Initialization is taken care of along their individual requirements of implementing classes. These classes also have to synchronize the methods of this interface!

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] decrypt(byte[] buffer)
      Decrypts a buffer of data.
      byte[] decrypt(byte[] buffer, int start, int length)
      Decrypts a section of a user data buffer.
      byte[] encrypt(byte[] buffer)
      Encrypts a buffer of data.
      byte[] encrypt(byte[] buffer, int start, int length)
      Encrypts a section of a user data buffer.
      int getBlockSize()
      Returns the blocksize of this cipher or 0 if this cipher is not a block-cipher.

    • Method Detail

      • decrypt

        byte[] decrypt(byte[] buffer)
        Decrypts a buffer of data. The input buffer data will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        buffer - encrypted data; length must be an integer multiple of the cipher's blocksize; 0 allowed
        Returns:
        the decrypted data array (same length as buffer)

      • decrypt

        byte[] decrypt(byte[] buffer,
               int start,
               int length)
        Decrypts a section of a user data buffer. The input buffer data will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        buffer - encrypted data
        start - the start offset in the buffer of the source ciphertext block
        length - the length of the ciphertext block; must be an integer multiple of the cipher's blocksize; 0 allowed
        Returns:
        the decrypted data array of length length

      • encrypt

        byte[] encrypt(byte[] buffer)
        Encrypts a buffer of data. The input buffer data will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        buffer - cleartext data; length must be an integer multiple of the cipher's blocksize; 0 allowed
        Returns:
        the encrypted data array (same length as buffer)

      • encrypt

        byte[] encrypt(byte[] buffer,
               int start,
               int length)
        Encrypts a section of a user data buffer. The input buffer data will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        buffer - cleartext data
        start - the start offset in the buffer of the source cleartext block
        length - the length of the cleartext block; must be an integer multiple of the cipher's blocksize; 0 allowed
        Returns:
        the encrypted data array of length length

      • getBlockSize

        int getBlockSize()
        Returns the blocksize of this cipher or 0 if this cipher is not a block-cipher.
